Sentence.sentence: There were no longer enough fish in the sea for the stock to maintain itself, let alone an industry.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It had, apparently, been fished out of existence; and the once mighty Newfoundland fleet now gropes about frantically for crab on the sea floor.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: South Korea, which operates state-of-the-art bases here, is increasing its fishing of krill ( ' , 磷虾), found in abundance in the Southern Ocean, while Russia recently frustrated efforts to create one of the world's largest ocean sanctuaries here.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The pollutants in the ponds appear to come from fish that fulmars eat when they’re out on the ocean.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The bodies of fish and other meat eaters can build up high levels of the chemicals.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Salmon also carry dangerous chemicals as the fish migrate between rivers and the sea.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: People who live, hunt or fish near bird coloniesneed to be careful, the researchers say, The birds don’t mean to cause harm, but the chemicals they carry can cause major problems.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Birds flock together, fish school together, cattle herd together.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Many people now say the benefits of switching to vegetarian diet which excludes meat and fish.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Whenever they responded correctly, they were rewarded with fish.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: As the ocean warms, a body of water called the Antarctic Polar Front - an upward movement of nutrient-rich sea that supports a huge abundance of marine life - is being pushed further south. This means that king penguins, which feed on fish and krill in th
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: birds flock together, fish school together, cattle herd together...just perceiving norms is enough to cause people to adjust their behaviour in the direction of the crowd.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: fish have a refuge in the streams and can expand into the lagoons when the lake is low and the lagoons are separate, Harper said All the lagoons join when the lake is high and fish must retreat to their stream refuges or die.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: It is home to one of the world's finest marine ecosystems,with more than 1,300 species of fish and 700 species of coral.

Sentence.sentence: Otherwise, no fish are able to survive in the naturally toxic lake.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Some fish, too, have had limited success vacationing at the lake as less salty lagoons form on the outer edges from hot springs flowing into Lake Natron.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The low-carbohydrate food movement gave birth to such diets as the Atkins, Paleo and Keto, which advised swapping foods like bread, pasta and potatoes for vegetables, fish and meat.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: These include the centuries-old custom of "bul",  where leaders would call a temporary stop to fishing for key species in order to give fish stocks an opportunity to replenish.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: They all wanted to turn around and go home! You know, back to teabags and fish and chips.

Sentence.sentence: They called a submarine an iron fish and a small bomb thrown by hand a potato.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: wine, bread, olive oil, and nuts are other staples of the region, and the Mediterranean Sea has historically yielded abundant quantities of fish.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

jx.jx_en_mean: a person in a completely unsuitable environment or situation

jx.jx_en_mean: have other (or more important) matters to attend to

phrase.cizu_name: neither fish nor fowl (nor good red herring)

jx.jx_en_mean: of indefinite character and difficult to identify or classify

phrase.cizu_name: there are plenty more fish in the sea

jx.jx_en_mean: used to console someone whose romantic relationship has ended by pointing out that there are many other people with whom they may have a successful relationship in the future
jx.jx_cn_mean: 海里好鱼多的是；天涯何处无芳草

jx.jx_en_mean: To deplete (a lake, for example) of fish by fishing.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 捕尽：用捕或钓的方式把（如湖）鱼捕尽

jx.jx_en_mean: To try to take advantage of a confused situation.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 混水摸鱼：在一片混乱中攫取好处

phrase.cizu_name: fish or cut bait【非正式用语】

jx.jx_en_mean: To proceed with an activity or abandon it altogether.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在两者中作出选择：要么继续干下去，要么全部放弃

phrase.cizu_name: like a fish out of water

jx.jx_en_mean: Completely unfamiliar with one's surroundings or activity.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 如鱼离水的，感到生疏：对自己所处的环境或所干的事完全不熟悉的
非驴非马的，不伦不类的：没有明显的特征的；不确定的

entry.def: A fish is a creature that lives in water and has a tail and fins. There are many different kinds of fish.

example.ex: I was chatting to an islander who had just caught a fish...
example.tran: 我正在跟一个刚刚抓到一条鱼的岛民聊天。

example.ex: The fish were counted and an average weight recorded.
example.tran: 数了数鱼的数量，并把平均重量记录了下来。

entry.def: Fish is the flesh of a fish eaten as food.

example.ex: Does dry white wine go best with fish?
example.tran: 吃鱼时喝干白葡萄酒是最佳选择吗？

entry.def: If you fish, you try to catch fish, either for food or as a form of sport or recreation.

example.ex: Brian remembers learning to fish in the River Cam.
example.tran: 布赖恩记得曾在剑河学过钓鱼。

entry.def: If you fish a particular area of water, you try to catch fish in it.

example.ex: On Saturday we fished the River Arno.
example.tran: 周六我们在阿尔诺河钓鱼。

entry.def: If you say that someone is fishing for information or praise, you disapprove of the fact that they are trying to get it from someone in an indirect way.
entry.tran: 旁敲侧击地打听;拐弯抹角地谋取

example.ex: He didn't want to create the impression that he was fishing for information...
example.tran: 他不想让人觉得自己是在套话。

example.ex: She may be fishing for a compliment and welcome your reassurance...
example.tran: 她也许是在拐弯抹角地想获得称赞，希望得到你的肯定。

entry.def: If you feel like a fish out of water, you do not feel comfortable or relaxed because you are in an unusual or unfamiliar situation.
entry.tran: 如离水之鱼(指因离开熟悉的环境而感到不适)

example.ex: I think he thought of himself as a country gentleman and was like a fish out of water in Birmingham.
example.tran: 我想他认为自己是一名乡绅，在伯明翰就如离水之鱼一般浑身不自在。

entry.def: If you tell someone that there are plenty more fish in the sea, you are comforting them by saying that although their relationship with someone has failed, there are many other people they can have relationships with.
entry.tran: 海里的鱼有的是;天涯何处无芳草

entry.def: If you fish something out from somewhere, you take or pull it out, often after searching for it for some time.

example.ex: Kelly fished out another beer from his cooler...
example.tran: 凯莉从他的冷藏箱里又拿出一瓶啤酒。

example.ex: She fished out a pair of David's socks for her cold feet.
example.tran: 她找出一双戴维的袜子穿在了冰冷的脚上。

means.word_mean: 1. any of various mostly cold-blooded aquatic vertebrates usually having scales and breathing through gills;

sentences.sentence: "in the livingroom there was a tank of colorful fish"

means.word_mean: 2. the flesh of fish used as food;

sentences.sentence: "in Japan most fish is eaten raw"
"after the scare about foot-and-mouth disease a lot of people started eating fish instead of meat"
"they have a chef who specializes in fish"

means.word_mean: 2. catch or try to catch fish or shellfish;

sentences.sentence: "I like to go fishing on weekends"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English fisc (as a noun denoting any animal living exclusively in water), fiscian (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vis, vissen and German Fisch, fischen
early 16th cent.: probably from French fiche, from ficher 'to fix', based on Latin figere
